abstract: A new job title â€” chief of laboratory safety â€” will be created at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, the agency announced Wednesday.
headline: New C.D.C. Job Overseeing Laboratory Safety
keywords: [{'name': 'persons', 'value': 'McNeil, Donald G Jr', 'rank': 1, 'major': 'N'}, {'name': 'organizations', 'value': 'Centers for Disease Control and Prevention', 'rank': 2, 'major': 'N'}, {'name': 'subject', 'value': 'Ebola Virus', 'rank': 3, 'major': 'N'}, {'name': 'subject', 'value': 'Laboratories and Scientific Equipment', 'rank': 4, 'major': 'N'}, {'name': 'persons', 'value': 'Frieden, Thomas R', 'rank': 5, 'major': 'N'}, {'name': 'subject', 'value': 'Accidents and Safety', 'rank': 6, 'major': 'N'}]
lead_paragraph: A new job title â€” chief of laboratory safety â€” will be created at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, the agency said Wednesday. The move follows a series of lab accidents, the most recent of which may have exposed a scientist to the Ebola virus. Applicants are being recruited, and a spokeswoman said that whoever filled the post would report directly to the C.D.C.'s director, currently Dr. Thomas R. Frieden. Each of the agencyâ€™s divisions had handled lab safety separately. In the past year, different high-security C.D.C. labs shipped out samples of anthrax, H5N1 bird flu and Ebola that had not been properly killed. Thus far, there have been no injuries and no spread of the pathogens, but the agencyâ€™s procedures have been heavily criticized as sloppy.
snippet: A new job title â€” chief of laboratory safety â€” will be created at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, the agency announced Wednesday.

abstract: Lawyers for Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, the defendant in the 2013 Boston Marathon bombings, made a last-ditch effort late Wednesday to move the trial out of Boston.
headline: Massachusetts: New Effort to Move Bombings Trial
keywords: [{'name': 'subject', 'value': 'Boston Marathon Bombings (2013)', 'rank': 2, 'major': 'N'}, {'name': 'persons', 'value': 'Tsarnaev, Dzhokhar A', 'rank': 3, 'major': 'N'}, {'name': 'glocations', 'value': 'Boston (Mass)', 'rank': 4, 'major': 'N'}]
lead_paragraph: Lawyers for Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, the defendant in the 2013 Boston Marathon bombings, made a last-ditch effort late Wednesday to move the trial out of Boston. In a 32-page filing, they asked a federal appeals court to grant a change of venue, or at a minimum to order the trial judge, George A. Oâ€™Toole Jr., to hold a hearing on moving the trial. They also asked Judge Oâ€™Toole to delay the start of jury selection, which is scheduled for Monday, while the appeals court considers its request. Judge Oâ€™Toole has twice denied the request, most recently earlier Wednesday, saying the jury selection process could find impartial jurors. But Mr. Tsarnaevâ€™s lawyers insisted that would be impossible, arguing that virtually everyone in the Boston region has a connection to the marathon and is, â€œin effect, an actual victim.â€ Government prosecutors have until 5 p.m. Thursday to respond.
snippet: Lawyers for Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, the defendant in the 2013 Boston Marathon bombings, made a last-ditch effort late Wednesday to move the trial out of Boston.

lead_paragraph: There was $383 billion in mergers and acquisitions in the oil and gas sector last year, as of Dec. 11. Yet Europe has largely missed out: About three-quarters of the targets have been in North America, according to Thomson Reuters data. Shale has played a big role. In 2015, oil and gas bankers in Europe will get a bigger slice of the action.

abstract: Two conductors, both leading German orchestras, have released sets of Brahmsâ€™s symphonies within a year of each other. Whatâ€™s the difference?
headline: Brahms From Different Batons
keywords: [{'name': 'persons', 'value': 'Allen, David', 'rank': 1, 'major': 'N'}, {'name': 'subject', 'value': 'Music', 'rank': 2, 'major': 'N'}, {'name': 'persons', 'value': 'Chailly, Riccardo', 'rank': 3, 'major': 'N'}, {'name': 'persons', 'value': 'Thielemann, Christian', 'rank': 4, 'major': 'N'}, {'name': 'persons', 'value': 'Brahms, Johannes', 'rank': 5, 'major': 'N'}, {'name': 'subject', 'value': 'Classical Music', 'rank': 6, 'major': 'N'}]
lead_paragraph: Over the last few years, Riccardo Chailly and Christian Thielemann have been engaged in a quiet, almost implicit battle for the soul of the orchestral repertoire. Both pursue a markedly different style of conducting. Both relate to tradition in conflicting ways, even as they work with some of the oldest orchestras. And both, as if to confound the stories told about the industry today, have their recordings lavishly presented by major record labels.
snippet: Two conductors, both leading German orchestras, have released sets of Brahmsâ€™s symphonies within a year of each other. Whatâ€™s the difference?

abstract: The Royal Danish Ballet will perform the work of the 19th-century Romantic August Bournonville in a program of excerpts at the Joyce Theater.
headline: The Olden Days, With Nymphs and Trolls
keywords: [{'name': 'subject', 'value': 'Dancing', 'rank': 1, 'major': 'N'}, {'name': 'persons', 'value': 'Bournonville, August', 'rank': 2, 'major': 'N'}, {'name': 'organizations', 'value': 'Joyce Theater', 'rank': 3, 'major': 'N'}, {'name': 'organizations', 'value': 'Royal Danish Ballet', 'rank': 4, 'major': 'N'}]
lead_paragraph: For more than half a century, Americans have felt a kind of fascination for Danish dancers. The attraction dates at least to the 1950s, when a small group from the Royal Danish Ballet traveled to the Jacobâ€™s Pillow Dance Festival in Becket, Mass., for the first time. At those performances, audiences and critics were charmed by the companyâ€™s buoyant dancing, amiable stage manner and seemingly natural acting abilities. The most celebrated ballets were by August Bournonville, a 19th-century choreographer in the Romantic vein who has come to define the Danish style. An ensemble of 13 dancers from the company, led by the principal dancer Ulrik Birkkjaer, will perform a program of Bournonville excerpts at the Joyce Theater in Manhattan from Jan. 13 to 18.
snippet: The Royal Danish Ballet will perform the work of the 19th-century Romantic August Bournonville in a program of excerpts at the Joyce Theater.

lead_paragraph: If you read wedding announcements, you may have noticed that members of the clergy do not matter as much as they used to. More and more people are married by judges, or justices of the peace, or friends who get officiating privileges from the state. Others use what we might call â€œclergy lite,â€ ordained by online services like the Universal Life Church, which has but two tenets â€” â€œTo promote freedom of religionâ€ and â€œTo do that which is rightâ€ â€” and requires only your name and email address and a promise that you are â€œover the age of 13.â€
